data.meanings: to be saleable, to come out of a hole, be exhausted (store), consumed, spent, expenditure. To enter into another hole where there is another outlet, so is a hypocrite who professes to believe first one thing and then another, thus entering faith through one door and leaving it through another.nafaqan (n.acc.) hole with another outlet, tunnel.nafaqatun (n.) worthy to be spent, expenditure.nafaqu (prt. 3rd p. m. plu. III) practised hypocrisy.nafaqa (v.) to profess hypocrisy, believe in one thing and then another.munafiqun (m. plu. III acc.) those who are hypocrite.munafiqin (m. plu. III acc.) those who are hypocrite.munafiqat (f. plu. III) hypocrite womennifaq (v. n. III) hypocrisynifaqan (v. n. III acc.) hypocrisyanfaqa (perf. 3rd p. m. sing. IV) he had spentanfaqta (perf. 2nd p. m. sing. IV) thou hath spent.anfaqu (perf. 3rd p. m. plu. IV) they have spentanfaqtum (perf. 2nd p. m. plu. IV) Ye have spentyunfiqu (imp. 3rd p. m. sing. IV) spendstunfiquna (imp. 3rd p. m. plu. IV) Ye spendtunfiqu (imp. 2nd p. m. plu. IV acc.) Ye spendanfiqu prt. m. plu. IV) spendinfaq (v. n. ) spendingmunfiqina (m. plu.) those who spend

data.meanings: to be close, near, follow, be up to.tawalla (prf. 3rd. m. sing.) - turneth away.tawallau (prf. 3rd. m. pl.) - they turned away.tawallaitum (prf. 2nd. m. pl.) - ye turned away.yatawalla (impf. 3rd. m. pl.) - he turns away.
data.sentence: The word تَوَلَّوْا comes from the root و ل ي and is associated with the meanings: to be close, near, follow, be up to.tawalla (prf. 3rd. m. sing.) - turneth away.tawallau (prf. 3rd. m. pl.) - they turned away.tawallaitum (prf. 2nd. m. pl.) - ye turned away.yatawalla (impf. 3rd. m. pl.) - he turns away.

data.meanings: to be copious, overflow, abound, flow freely, spread. afada - to pour, proceed, return, be immersed in any business or communication, go from a place to another in a crowd. (it is both transitive and intransitive)
data.sentence: The word تَفِيضُ comes from the root ف ي ض and is associated with the meanings: to be copious, overflow, abound, flow freely, spread. afada - to pour, proceed, return, be immersed in any business or communication, go from a place to another in a crowd. (it is both transitive and intransitive)
The word الدَّمْعِ comes from the root د م ع and is associated with the meanings: To shed tears.

data.meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.

data.meanings: to hurt in the eye, smite anyone with the evil eye, flow tears, become a spy. Aayan - to view, face. 'Ainun - eye, look, hole, but of a tree, spy, middle letter of a trilateral word, spring of water, chief, personage of a place. A'yan (pl. 'Inun): lovely, wide-eyed, lovely black eyed. Ma'iinun - water, spring.
data.sentence: The word وَأَعْيُنُهُمْ comes from the root ع ي ن and is associated with the meanings: to hurt in the eye, smite anyone with the evil eye, flow tears, become a spy. Aayan - to view, face. 'Ainun - eye, look, hole, but of a tree, spy, middle letter of a trilateral word, spring of water, chief, personage of a place. A'yan (pl. 'Inun): lovely, wide-eyed, lovely black eyed. Ma'iinun - water, spring.
The word حَزَنًا comes from the root ح ز ن and is associated with the meanings: To grieve.
